isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - INSTALL - INTERMEDIATE SECTION

step1.para: Place the intermediate housing on the dowel pins and against the front case ( Figure 247).

figure.caption: Figure 246. Place Intermediate Housing on Dowel Pins

step1.para: Secure the intermediate housing to the front case with 13 bolts (9 short, 4 long) ( Figure 248). Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m). DO NOT install bolts in the two center holes.

figure.caption: Figure 247. Secure Intermediate Housing to Front Case With Bolts

step1.para: Place a snap ring spacer in both front auxiliary countershaft bearing bores ( Figure 249).

figure.caption: Figure 248. Place Snap Ring Spacer in Front Auxiliary Countershaft Bearing Bores

step1.para: Install the metal oil trough in the intermediate housing with two bolts in the front wall and one bolt in the top of the housing ( Figure 250). The spacer is placed between the oil trough and the top of the case. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 249. Install Oil Trough in Intermediate Housing

important.para: Mark the low speed gear tooth identified with an "O" on each auxiliary countershaft for timing purposes. Then mark the tooth on the intermediate and drive gears which align with this tooth ( Figure 251). Install the bearing on the front of each countershaft, seating against the shaft shoulder.

figure.caption: Figure 250. Mark Teeth For Timing Purposes

step1.para: Place the left countershaft into position in the bearing bore ( Figure 252).

figure.caption: Figure 251. Place Left Countershaft into Position in Bearing Bore

step1.para: Place the right countershaft into position, but do not completely seat the front bearing in the bore ( Figure 253).

figure.caption: Figure 252. Place Right Countershaft into Position

step1.para: On the auxiliary drive gear and sliding clutch assembly, mark two adjacent teeth on the drive (larger width) gear and mark the two teeth directly opposite ( Figure 254).

Install the auxiliary drive gear and sliding clutch assembly on the splines of the mainshaft, aligning both sections with the splines. Mesh the marked tooth on each countershaft between the marked teeth of the auxiliary drive gear ( Figure 255).

figure.caption: Figure 254. Mesh Marked Teeth of Countershafts With Marked Teeth of Auxiliary Drive Gear

note.para: Keep the marked teeth on the countershafts parallel.

step1.para: Place the intermediate shift yoke in the yoke slot of the auxiliary drive gear/ sliding clutch assembly, hub to the rear ( Figure 256).

figure.caption: Figure 255. Place Intermediate Shift Yoke in Yoke Slot of Auxiliary Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the intermediate shift shaft through the bore in the housing and the yoke hub ( Figure 257). Secure with the lockscrew and wire.

Install the snap ring, plate and second snap ring in the inner diameter of the intermediate drive gear, noting that the raised side of the plate faces toward the front of the transmission. Mark two adjacent teeth on the gear and the two teeth directly opposite ( Figure 258).
Place the drive gear on the rear of the mainshaft, meshing the marked tooth on each countershaft between the marked teeth on the drive gear ( Figure 259).

figure.caption: Figure 258. Place Drive Gear on Rear of Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the retaining plate on the rear of the mainshaft with the two bolts ( Figure 260). Tighten to 20 ft-lbs. (27 N·m). Secure bolts by bending the tabs of the retainer plate.

figure.caption: Figure 259. Install Retaining Plate on Rear of Mainshaft
